page.title: 09EDINBANE - CALUM HAMISH
page.content: Everyone knows my Granda, Calum Hamish Macfarlane. He has lived most of his life in the croft house his father built. My Grandfather was a stone-mason. Fifty years ago he helped to build our school. His last job was building an entrance gateway for the Lodge Hotel. During the Depression in the 1930s Granda went to London to Work. That was went he wrote his song about Edinabme. Here is part of the fourth verse:- "Is fhada bho'n aite mi 's an d'fhuair mi m'arach og Is bho'n a Ghaidhlig mi A bardachd is a ceol" "I am far from the place where I was brought up. I am far from the Gaelic tongue the poetry and the music. Granda has written other songs as well. he also sings and plays the bagpipes.
